page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY, THE TURNPIKE
page.content: The route along the upper Usk valley has been an important line of communic -ation from Brecon westwards through- out recorded history. Until the end of the 18th Century the route westwards lay over the hills to the north of the present USK RESERVOIR, 10 km further west. At that time the new turnpike road from London to Fishguard was made through the GWYDDERIG valley between LLYWEL and LLANDOVERY. This is the route occupied by the trunk road A 40, which was the main trunk road between London and West Wales until the M4 motorway was constructed from the Severn Bridge to Pontardulais in the 1970's. A 40 is now much quieter than formerly but it is still the main route to West Wales from the Midlands and Northern England.
